sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content:
Pic.FileNew is used to obtain a picture from a file. The Pic.FileNew procedure allocates the memory for the picture, which can be very large for pictures of large areas. The memory is freed up when the program calls Pic.Free with the picture ID. The picture can be used with the Pic.Draw and Pic.Save.

The fileNameparameter must give the format of the file:

  GIF files   "GIF:filename" or "filename.GIF"
  JPG files   "JPG:filename" or "filename.JPG"
  BMP files   "BMP:filename" or "filename.BMP"
sections.mdown_content:
**Pic.FileNew **is used to obtain a picture from a file. The 
**Pic.FileNew** procedure allocates the memory for the picture, 
which can be very large for pictures of large areas. The memory is 
freed up when the program calls **Pic.Free** with the picture ID. 
The picture can be used with the **Pic.Draw** and 
**Pic.Save**.
The *fileName*parameter must give the format of the file:


 
GIF files
 
"GIF:filename" or "filename.GIF"
 
JPG files
 
"JPG:filename" or "filename.JPG"
 
BMP files
 
"BMP:filename" or "filename.BMP"

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: Various versions of Turing can convert different formats of files. Turing 4.1 for Windows can load BMP, GIF and JPG files.
sections.mdown_content:
Various versions of Turing can convert different formats of files. 
Turing 4.1 for Windows can load BMP, GIF and JPG files.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: For, multi-frame GIF files (GIF files that have several frames or pictures and are used for animation), Pic.FileNew will only load the first frame. See the Pic.FileNewFrames and Pic.Frame for information on loading and displaying a multi-frame GIF file.
sections.mdown_content:
For, multi-frame GIF files (GIF files that have several frames or
pictures and are used for animation), **Pic.FileNew** will only
load the first frame.  See the **Pic.FileNewFrames** and
**Pic.Frame** for information on loading and displaying
a multi-frame GIF file.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: If the Pic.FileNew call fails, then it returns 0. Also Error.Last will return a non-zero value indicating the reason for the failure. Error.LastMsg will return a string which contains the textual version of the error.
sections.mdown_content:
If the **Pic.FileNew** call fails, then it returns 0. Also 
**Error.Last** will return a non-zero value indicating the 
reason for the failure. **Error.LastMsg** will return a string 
which contains the textual version of the error.

sections.title: Example
code:
var picID: int
        var x, y : int
        
        picID := Pic.FileNew ("mypic.bmp")
        for i : 1 .. 50
            x := Rand.Int (0, maxx)     % Random x
            y := Rand.Int (0, maxy)     % Random y
            Pic.Draw (picID, x, y, picCopy)
        end for
        Pic.Free (picID)
sections.raw_content: The program reads a graphic from the file mypic.bmp and then draws it 50 times.
sections.mdown_content:
The program reads a graphic from the file *mypic.bmp* and then 
draws it 50 times.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Pic.FileNew, not by calling FileNew.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling 
**Pic.FileNew**, not by calling **FileNew**.
